resources.string: You have no color vision deficiencies.
You have Protanopia (a deficiency in perceiving red).
You have Deuteranopia (a deficiency in perceiving green).
You have a color vision deficiency.\nWe recommend visiting an ophthalmologist for further evaluation.
What do you see in the image?\n\nChoose one option:

This application is a simple color blindness test. It helps determine the presence and type of color vision deficiency using a series of images.

The first 14 images are designed to detect general color vision deficiencies. Images 15 to 18 help identify more specific forms of color blindness, such as Protanopia and Deuteranopia.

Color blindness is a visual impairment where a person cannot distinguish certain colors or shades. The tests help identify different forms of color blindness, such as Protanopia and Deuteranopia.
